callforshadab wrote:
>
> Hi,
> I am trying to write my own extractor.
> But still i am in dark about how this happens in HTMLExtractor...
> How it fetches the link, who calls this??? And if i have to write my
> own extractor, then whiach are the place where i have to make entries
> for that and how it will be called...?????
>
> Can anybuddy help me in figuring this out ????
>








Start with the developers manual.  Its a little dated but tells a good 
story -- with pictures! -- about how processors work.  (Extractors are a 
specialization of Processor).   Next study current Extractors.  There 
are a bunch to choose from: 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/extractor/package-summary.html.  
Start with the more basic -- such as 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/extractor/ExtractorXML.html 
-- and work your way up to the most awkward, HTMLExtractor.

Yours,
St.Ack
